import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.bdd05cc2:
ts = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/trend-sents/trendsents.csv")
ts = ts.drop([10], axis=0)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.style.use('seaborn-ticks')
ts.set_index("Topic",inplace=True)
ts.plot.barh(stacked=True, figsize=(10, 6)).legend(loc='center left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 0.5))
plt.title('Sentiment of Trending Topic Tweets')
plt.xlabel('Sentiment')
plt.ylabel('Topic')
plt.show()
source.c175c8e5:
plt.style.use('seaborn-ticks')
ts2.set_index("Topic",inplace=True)
ts2.plot.barh(stacked=True, figsize=(10, 6)).legend(loc='center left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 0.5))
plt.title('Sentiment of Trending Topic Tweets')
plt.xlabel('Sentiment (Percent of total)')
plt.ylabel('Topic')
plt.show()
source.e4570617:
In my project I looked at the sentiment of trending topic tweets on Twitter. Originally I had intended to do sentiment analysis with MonkeyLearn, but the free account was too restrictive so I used MeaningCloud instead. These are the topics I analyzed:

Trending topics:
1. Daniel Radcliffe
2. Papa Mochi
3. #BlackLivesMatter
4. #BlakeLivesMatter
5. #ShutDownSTEM
6. B Simone
7. Stephen Miller
8. Vita
9. Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone
10. Rage Against the Machine

Sentiment analysis for tweets doesn't tell you how the person feels about the topic, but rather the general sentiment of the tweet itself. So this wont be used to analyze feelings about the topics, instead I'm looking at whether or not trending topics inspire strong feelings (either positive or negative) in general. The sentment was classified as either Positive (P), very positive (P+), negative (N), very negative (N+), neutral (NEU), or no sentiment (NONE)
source.da0fbb70:
I had expected all topics to have a small percentage of none and neutral. For the topics this was not the case for it, it looks like it may have been due to larger number of tweets in other langauges besides English and Spanish, and larger numbers of images, which got categorized as "none". It was also clear that the classifier could not recognize sarcasm. 

Examples of classifier successes:

RT @BeauTFC: I mean sure sex is great and all, but have you ever seen "capitol hill autonomous zone" trending?	P+

RT @jeonridley: i love you so much daniel radcliffe https://t.co/tlLj7oMmFS	P+

RT @BRRN_Fed: Good morning to the Seattle Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone! 🌞☕️✊ https://t.co/6UTD8FSv1y	P

RT @thelindsayellis: This was nice to see. https://t.co/mEj1igDsyD	P

"RT @anarchomastia: ALERTA: Cops have taken away some of the barricades at the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone. we need more barricade materials to keep the area safe: please if possible bring wooden boards, cinder blocks, bricks, old furniture, etc. -anything to help build up the barricades"	NEU

RT @MapsCats: Stuff like this trends because a few people made a typo, an algorithm decided to complete "Bla..." with Blake, and then people pile onto the hashtag wondering who the fuck Blake is and why he's trending. There is no Blake.  #BlakeLivesMatter https://t.co/zyPFz9uFsb	NEU

"Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone is a problem for the white boys who think having guns and being a vet is a personality because it shows how fucking useless they are. It shows how they're only a tool for the rich. Pathetic."	N

RT @BeaCompiler: You know you are on the wrong side of history when a pair of last airbenders show up to protest against your org. #BlakeLivesMatter https://t.co/iTNBikq492	N

ho dovuto aspettare le 2 di notte per poter rivedere l'mv dei wayv perchè dovevo finire di studiare che vita triste :((	N

RT @amogh_astra: #ShutDownSTEM is the most regressive movement ever to touch science. It's only second to the church suppressing people and facts that went against the Bible.	N+

RT @urayoangarced: "Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone" borders are racist. Takedown the barricades.	N+

RT @SocialistVaultB: What if we kissed in the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone???	NONE
#ShutDownSTEM https://t.co/C9M1o8hmux	NONE


And failures:

RT @GeorgeTakei: Having Stephen Miller write the White House speech on race relations is like having Jeffrey Dahmer select the menu items.	P+

RT @kipjmooney: People getting upset when they discover Rage Against the Machine is political will never stop being funny. https://t.co/VF7ErW3c1Y	NEU

RT @Nash076: Holy shit what a class act https://t.co/75ObcLL6Sz	N+
